header.type: HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: Mr Nakwa as I am looking to your statement here you are going to tell us about your father, Mzayifani Alfred Nakwa.
You have mentioned your uncle, Golete Nakwa.
You are going to tell us about these two people here.
Let us begin with your father's story.  You said that he was arrested.  For how long was he arrested?
As I was still young at the time I am not sure about this, but I can just estimate that it was plus minus one year.
How old were you at the time of this incident?
I was about seven years old.
Your father, was he a member of Congo?
Yes I can say so, although I cannot be sure, but because he was arrested at the time when Congo members were arrested, I can say so.
How was his health at the time of his release?
He was very sick and as I was young at the time I saw him being beaten up by the boers, because they would kick him and would beat him with the back of their rifles.
You mean that on this day that he was arrested, you were there, and you saw them beating him up?
How did you feel when you saw your father being beaten up in front of you as you were still a child and he was your father.
This was very painful to us.  Even today I have a picture of that day.
What did he say happened while he was in prison?
He told us that they were not fed well and it was very cold inside.
You said that he passed away in 1973.
And he died due to injuries sustained in prison?

Yes, because since then he was not well and he could even go back to work to work for us, because I could not even go to school, because he wanted me to go to school, but he could not go back to work to work for us.
Do you have a request you want to make to this Commission?
Yes Sir.   I have children and I would like the Commission to help me in my children's education.
Let us now go to the case of Golete Nakwa who was also arrested.  Can you please tell us what happened to him?

I do not know where he was arrested.   I did not see when they arrested him.  I just heard that my uncle was also arrested, as they were arresting anybody in the village.   I saw him when he came back from jail.  I
do not know where they arrested him, but he just told us that he was arrested.
Was he also a member of Congo?
Yes, he was a member of  Congo.
What was his state of health when he came back from prison.
He was coughing all the time.  He was also vomiting and he died later on.
You have already mentioned the requests to this Commission concerning yourself and your children.  Do you have any other requests for the Commission to pass on to the President?
No Sir I have  no further requests.
